main_definition: Pressure refers to the influence or force exerted upon someone or something, often causing stress or a demand to act in a certain way.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The physical force applied on an object
meanings_and_examples.example: When water is pumped into a balloon, it exerts pressure on the walls of the balloon.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Social or psychological force that compels someone to behave in a certain way
meanings_and_examples.example: She felt immense pressure from her parents to succeed academically.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Forcing oneself or others to do something against their will
meanings_and_examples.example: He was pressured into accepting the job offer despite his initial hesitations.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of exerting force on a surface in order to make an impression or leave a mark
meanings_and_examples.example: Using a stamp, one can apply pressure to paper to create an imprint.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A situation where someone is forced to compete or perform under stressful conditions
meanings_and_examples.example: The high-pressure environment of the Olympic Games forces athletes to perform at their best despite challenging circumstances.
